info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued June 16 at 3:47PM EDT until June 16 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 415 PM EDT FOR CENTRAL PRINCE GEORGE...NORTHEASTERN SUSSEX AND NORTHWESTERN SURRY COUNTIES AND THE SOUTHEASTERN CITY OF PETERSBURG... At 347 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Disputanta, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and half dollar size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. This severe storm will be near... Garysville around 350 PM EDT. Burrowsville around 405 PM EDT. Cabin Point around 410 PM EDT. Claremont around 425 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this severe thunderstorm include New Bohemia, Taylors Corner, Carsley, Richard Bland College, Birchett Estate, Prince George Golf, Spring Grove, Gwaltney Corner, Oak Hill Corner and Jordan Point Country Club. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.25 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
